reviewText: Look I can't pretend to be an expert on Pac-Man emulation, but this certainly seems like a solid implementation of Pac-Man, runs smooth, some nice graphics and sound options, but it's still Pac-Man. It's a classic for a reason.\n\nPac-Man Museum may be a better deal, especially for the never released on PC elsewhere Pac-Man Championship Edition (Not DX), but that game is locked to some ridiculous resolution settings. This will run just fine in a window with no complaints. Ms. Pac-Man as well is probably a better product too, but, hey, this does what you expect it to do.

reviewText: Ah, yes. Pac-Man. The yellow ball with an eating disorder is back again, and is already beloved by many even on this very day. Obviously this is a straight port from the arcade to Steam. But I'm not complaining. It's still addicting as heck. Who could not enjoy gobbling up Pac-Dots, Fruits, and the main course, the Ghosts.\n\nEven if you're not born from the 80's, you can discover the true origins of how Pac-Man became a classic hit just by playing the game.

reviewText: Could use improved coding for the 360 controller.   Lag and random unresponsiveness plagues this game, much like Ms Pacman.  I found myself wondering why it's going left when I pushed up on the joystick.  Or why it does nothing at all at times.\n\nGreat for nostalgia and the game looks great.  Seems to play much like the original.  Just needs work on controller / input.  It feels more like playing an 80s arcade booth with a broken stick.  Do they not test these with any real game play before release?

reviewText:
Pac-Man was originally supposed to be called Puck-Man" but was changed to Pac-Man after the developers found out how easy it was to be changed to F***-Man in every English country.

REAL REVIEW
It's the exact 1980s classic.... on PC.

Before I played this
date: I was expecting a horrid PC port that was just a laggy emulation of the game. After playing a few games of it
recommended: I came to a conclusion that the port was not perfect
hoursPlayed: but was passable. The game is emulated almost perfectly. The only thing I noticed is that every once and awhile Pac-Man seems to get stuck sometimes when he turns. I don't remember if that was supposed to be part of the game or some glitch (If it isn't this part will be removed)
voteText: but it can be prevented by turning just at the right moment or if you do get stuck press any arrow key to get moving again. The last imperfection of this port is that the game has no mouse support and to exit the game you must click the red "x" on the top of the game's window (or Alt-F4 if you prefer).\n\nThe last few things you should know about this game is that it has Steam achievements and leaderboards
helpfulPercent: that is what separates this version from all the rest other than the fact that it's the only way to own the original Pac-Man game on PC offically (excluding the Pac-Man collection
votesHelpful: that port was much worse that this).\n\nHopefully my review was of some help

reviewText: This is a fantastic adaptation of the classic intense 1980 hit, PAC-MAN. From the sounds to the textures, the difference between the arcade version and this one are nearly seamless. If you have been searching for a version of this game like i have, than you are in luck. The only negatives i could find are the unintuitive menus. All in all this is a near perfect adaptation of this retro masterpiece of a game. KILLZONE Gives this game a 8/10. Highly recommended.
Such a good game!!! Get it for reliving the past!

Overall a great emulation of a great game.

PROS:
- Looks beautiful.
- Leaderboards

CONS:
- Can't change controls.

Pac-man stop working after PC upgrade. with my old i5 3450 ivy bridge 8gb ram HD6870 no problem
Now with i7 6700 Skylake 16gb ram GTX970 screen turns black, no sound.
Same with Galaga and Digdug.
Any ideas ?

Pac-man stop working after PC upgrade. with my old i5 3450 ivy bridge 8gb ram HD6870 no problem
Now with i7 6700 Skylake 16gb ram GTX970 screen turns black, no sound.
Same with Galaga and Digdug.
Any ideas ?

Awaiting updates, but...

This goes for all of Namco's 'Arcade Game Series' titles.

-No exit game option. (Need to Alt+F4 or end process)
-No key mapping
-No Fullscreen option (have to use Alt+Enter)
-No 360 arcade stick support (Mad Catz stick vetical axis is flipped, PS3 one works perfectly)
-Analog Stick deadzone is awful, often moves left while entering no input
-Needlessly massive downloads for such small games (800mb+)

Game's themselves are fine, but these shells they are in are atrocious. Some very basic functions have been missed and basic input support has not been offered. Unless these aren't fixed quickly, then I would suggest avoiding these or getting a refund if you have already purchased them.

reviewText:
I'm a massive fan of the original Pacman game. I;ve easily played a hundred hours of other ports over the last few years.

I can't recommend this port. It has some great things like leaderboards, scanlines and achievements.

The problem for me is in the most crucial area of a pacman game. The controls.

(Windows 10)
XBOX One controller does not work. Always moves left. I am aware of possible fixes but I know these break other games.

Anyway, that's not how I like to play pacman :)
I've an Arcade FightSick SFIV xbox 360 (set to 4 way mode via restrictor plates) which I've used for years to play pacman.

It does not work with this game :(

In Left Stick mode you get no response from joystick.
In DP mode you get Left and Right ok. However, Up and Down are switched.

Funny thing is that in Pacman Museum the stick works perfectly in LS mode.

A fix would be very welcome.

It might be better on a console.
+ It looks good

reviewText:
PLEASE NAMCO

Fix the controller support! This goes for all the ARCADE GAME SERIES

When using my Xbox One controller, it steers to the left no matter what I do. I don't think it would be hard to fix that problem. You can play the game normally with the arrow keys or WASD. But it's really frustrating to play that way.

GOOD:
- Perfect Emulation
- Achievements and Leaderboards are grand!
- Game settings let you start at any level you've reached (Also the essential Starting Lives and other things)

BAD:
- Limited Display Settings
- Bad Controller Support :(
- Can't change the controls

I would reccomend it if it had good controller support, because being forced to use the keyboard is lame.
